intro: Nototriche, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. These plants are characterized by their showy, yellow or orange composite flowers that attract various pollinators. Nototriche species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They have hairy leaves and stems, which help reduce water loss in dry climates. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine or horticulture.
